p: The antibacterial bioassay-guided fractionation flowchart of nutmeg is presented in Figure 1. The following four phytochemicals were identified: one alkenyl-benzene ( 1) and three neolignans ( 2, 3, and 4) from nutmeg. The yields of the four phytochemicals were 0.025% ( 1), 0.00005% ( 2), 0.0025% ( 3), and 0.0042% ( 4), respectively. The antibacterial effects were evaluated as previously described. The MICs of the four phytochemicals against C. acnes and S. aureus are shown in Table 1. Compound 2 displayed a more potent antibacterial activity than that exhibited by other compounds.
